titleproper.value:
Guide to the John Gerassi Papers
                    <num>ALBA.018</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Craig Savino and Jessica Weglein, July 2005

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-12-13T09:57-0500</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

extent.value: in 10 manuscript boxes and 7 record cartons

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
Journalist and scholar John ("Tito") Gerassi received his MA at Columbia University and earned his doctorate at the London School of Economics. Among his publications are 
                <title render="italic">The Great Fear in</title>
                <title render="italic">Latin America</title> (1965), 
                <title render="italic">The Boys of Boise</title> (1966), and the biography 
                <title render="italic">Jean-Paul Sartre: Hated Conscience of His Century</title> (1989). 
                <title render="italic">The Premature Anti-Fascists: Oral History of American and Canadian Volunteers in the Spanish Civil War</title> was published in 1986, and is a tribute to the men and women who volunteered to fight on behalf of the Spanish Republic. This collection consists chiefly of full transcriptions of 65 of the oral histories that were conducted for Gerassi's project (with supporting research materials) and unprocessed materials relating to Gerassi's research on Jean-Paul Sartre.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

The collection consists of oral history transcripts from Gerassi's project, 
                <title render="italic">The Premature Anti-Fascists: Oral History of American and Canadian Volunteers in the Spanish Civil War</title>, as well as materials used by Gerassi in the course of researching and writing the book. The collection also contains research conducted for his books on Jean-Paul Sartre.

corpname.value: Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade.

dsc.value:
Series I: Oral History Transcripts Scope and Content Note

This series is made up of full transcriptions of 65 of the oral histories that were conducted for Gerassi's project. Included here are transcripts for the following individuals: Bill Bailey, Alvah Bessie, Robert Colodny, Archie Brown, Walter Dent, Milt Felsen, Moe Fishman, John Gates, Carl Geiser, Robert Gladnick, Irving Goff, Syd Harris, Oscar Hunter, Evelyn Hutchins, Salaria Kee (a.k.a. Salaria Kea) O'Reilly, Admiral Kilpatrick, Edward Lending, Vincent Lossowski, Carl Marzani, John Murra, Steve Nelson, Lou Ornitz, Rosario Pistone, Herman Rosenstein (a.k.a. Gabby Klein), Walter Scheutrum, Morris Stamm, Robert Steck, George Watt, Irving Weissman, and Milton Wolff.

Salaria Kea) (duplicate) 5 9 undated Ornitz, Lou 6 1 undated Osheroff, Abe 6 2 undated Penrod, John 6 3 undated Penrod, John (duplicate) 6 4 undated Pistone, Rosario 6 5 undated Prago, Al 6 6 undated Reed, Robert 6 7 undated Rintz, Norman 6 8 undated Rosenstein, Herman 6 9 undated Rossen, John 6 10 undated Russell, Ross 6 11 undated Schmidt, Norman James 6 12 undated Shantzek, Mike 6 13 undated Skolnick, Abraham 6 14 undated Slater, Carl 6 15 undated Sorensen, Henning 6 16 undated Stamm, Morris 7 1 undated Stamm, Morris (radio interview) 7 2 undated Steck, Bob 7 3 undated Susman, Bill 7 4 undated Tisa, John and May 7 5 undated Watt, George 7 6 undated Weissman, Irving 7 7 undated Weissman, Irving (corrected) 7 8 undated Wellman, Saul (version 1 with edits) 8 1 undated Wellman, Saul (version 2 with edits) 8 2 undated Wolff, Milt 8 3 undated Series II: Subject Files Scope and Content Note

This series consists of clippings, articles, biographical files, research photocopies of correspondence from the Spanish Civil War-era, and some correspondence between Gerassi and individual veterans. Gerassi used these materials in the course of researching and writing his book. A file related to the Rockefeller Foundation grant received by Gerassi to fund this project can also be found here.

(photocopies) 8 8 undated Cohen, Milt 8 9 1983 Fajardo, Jose M.: “The International Brigades in the Spanish Civil War” ( Mundo Obreroarticle) 8 10 1979 Herrick, William 8 11 undated Larrando, Pacho Fernandez: “Foreigners and Strangers in the Civil War” ( Mucho Obreroarticle) 8 12 undated Lending, Ed: Correspondence (photocopies 1937, 1961-1979; originals 1980) 8 13 undated , 1980 Liversedge, Ronald (Canadian): Spanish Civil War Memoir, 1965 (photocopied typescript). 9 1 undated MacEachron, Paul: Correspondence (photocopy, 1937) 9 2 undated Mykola, Kit: Memoir (Canadian Volunteer) 9 3 undated Päviö, Jules (Finnish-Canadian Volunteer) 9 4 1981 Poem [Scab]: Author Unknown 9 5 undated Rockefeller Foundation Grant: Correspondence and Expense Reports 9 6 1981-1983 Robel, Charles Edward: Clippings (photocopies, undated, 1934-1938, 1976) 9 7 undated Robel, Charles Edward: Correspondence (photocopies, 1937) 9 8 undated Robel Family: Correspondence (photocopies, 1929-1937) 9 9 undated Sennett, William: Correspondence 9 10 1980 Smith, Randall (Pete) 9 11 undated , 1979 Spanish Refugee Aid 9 12 1978 Stamm, Morris: Clippings and Legal Documents (photocopies, 1949, 1977-1978) 9 13 undated Trotsky, Leon and Bertram Wolfe: Correspondence (research photocopies, 1936-1937) 9 14 undated Veterans: Annotated List 9 15 undated Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade 9 16 1981 VALB: Historical Commission Bulletin 9 17 1980 VALB: Questionnaires: Midwestern and West Coast Veterans 9 18 undated VALB: Questionnaires: Northeastern Veterans 9 19 undated Watt, George 9 20 undated Weissman, Irving 9 21 undated Wellman, Saul 9 22 undated Yaroshchuk, Yosyp 9 23 undated Series III: Unprocessed Materials 1940s-2000s Scope and Content Note

The unprocessed materials consist of federal government documents on John Gerassi and his family obtained through the Freedom of Information Act in the 1970s; subject files on various political topics, mainly from the 1970s; Gerassi's research and publicity materials for his biographies of Jean-Paul Sartre; Gerassi's articles and unpublished writings from the late 1960s-late 1980s; biographical materials; and loose news articles collected in the 2000s on a variety of political topics (some with annotations). There are also two reels of microfilm from the Hoover Institution labeled "Nuestra Industria Revista Economica" and approximately 50 cassette tapes, some on Sartre and some labeled "personal" or "political."

 Unprocessed Materials 10-17 1940s-2000s
